responsibilities: Develop tools and designs for threat detection and mitigation.
Conduct malware analysis, reverse engineering, and IoC enrichment.
Facilitate communication between product management and development teams.
Design and implement data pipelines for large datasets.
Develop machine learning models for threat detection.
Manage infrastructure using tools like Terraform and Ansible.
Develop analytic rules and playbooks for threat detection.
Create reports on vulnerabilities, threats, and risks.
Identify opportunities for continuous improvement in the MDR tool.
Engage with stakeholders to gather requirements and stay updated on industry trends.
analysis:
The job responsibilities and skills focus primarily on threat detection, malware analysis, data engineering, and infrastructure management. The responsibilities include developing tools for threat detection, conducting malware analysis, designing data pipelines, and developing machine learning models for threat detection. The skills required include threat hunting, data engineering, tool and design development, and infrastructure management.

There is no explicit mention of working with Generative AI (GenAI) or language models (LLMs) in the responsibilities or skills. The focus is more on cybersecurity, data engineering, and machine learning for threat detection rather than on natural language processing or generative tasks typically associated with GenAI or LLMs.

While machine learning is mentioned, it is in the context of threat detection rather than language model development or generative AI tasks. Therefore, it is unlikely that this job involves working with GenAI or LLMs.
